document.text: Abstract The connection between part-of-speech ( POS ) categories and morphological properties is well-documented in linguistics but underuti lized in text processing systems .
This pa per proposes a novel model for morphologi cal segmentation that is driven by this connec tion .

document.text: 1 Conclusion Although the connection between syntactic ( POS ) categories and morphological structure is wellknown , this relation is rarely exploited to improve morphological segmentation performance .
The performance gains motivate further investigation into morpho-syntactic models for unsupervised language analysis .
